results.firPara: The 4-0 debacle in Costa Rica on Tuesday showed that in American soccer, no one is challenged, and consequences for failure are rare. Something must change
results.secPara: The Purple Mermaids, an under-eight girls team, takes part in a New York City soccer league that has everyone plays as its motto. The league is not competitive, statistics are not recorded, and no results are logged. The keyword is participation and fun. The team will end its fall season this weekend with a trophy presentation. Each player will receive a plastic trophy after the final game, an award for the simple act of turning up.
results.webTitle: From top to bottom, US men's soccer is dripping in mediocrity | Matthew Hall

results.secPara: Ronald Koeman has sought to clarify his comments about Romelu Lukakus future by insisting it is Evertons responsibility to improve and convince the striker he can challenge for silverware at Goodison Park.
results.webTitle: Ronald Koeman states desire to see Romelu Lukaku stay at Everton

results.firPara: Mauricio Pochettino has insisted Tottenham Hotspurs injury problems are not about how we train after confirming Toby Alderweireld is still not fit to make his return to the first team.
results.secPara: The Belgian centre-half, who has been missing from the Spurs side since the middle of October, joins Erik Lamela and Ben Davies on the sidelines for this weekends Premier League fixture with West Ham. Dele Alli is also a concern and will be assessed on Friday.
results.webTitle: Toby Alderweireld not ready for Tottenham return – Mauricio Pochettino

results.firPara: Manchester Uniteds debt has risen by 18%, to close to £338m, in part due to Great Britains decision to leave the European Union.
results.secPara: The increased figure is included in financial results United have reported to the New York Stock Exchange for the first quarter of the new financial year. The clubs revenue for the three months ending 30 September 2016 is down by 2.8%, from £123.6m to £120.2m, while operating profit is down by 35%, to 6.2m. This is in part due to the clubs failure to qualify for the Champions League.
results.webTitle: Manchester United’s debt rises to £338m partly because of Brexit

results.firPara: On Saturday Arsenal travel to Old Trafford looking for their first league win at Manchester Uniteds home in a decade. In recent years, even as all else crumbled around the ears of whoever United had in charge, one constant comfort blanket they have clung to is the visit of the Gunners.
results.secPara: In the early 1980s, though, roles were reversed. Those years represented a fairly grim time for Arsenal they didnt win a major trophy between 1979-1987, although they did get to the FA Cup final and the Cup Winners Cup final in 1980. Their league campaigns were similarly barren, achieving a few top-four finishes (today regarded as something like an achievement but back then nothing to jump up and down about), and they were rarely serious title contenders. The football wasnt great either after a particularly stodgy 0-0 draw with Nottingham Forest in 1983, the then manager, Terry Neill, commented that he could only feel shame after a game like that.
results.webTitle: Ecstasy to agony: when Manchester United thumped Arsenal, then blew the title | Nick Miller

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp has defended Wayne Rooneys late-night socialising and described this generation of footballers as the most professional the game has seen. All the legends we love and admire drank like devils and smoked like crazy, the Liverpool manager claimed, who once wore a Santa Claus mask to avoid photographers on a Christmas night out.
results.secPara: Klopp offered support and sympathy for the Manchester United captain after he apologised unreservedly to the Football Association for being photographed at a wedding reception in the early hours of Sunday. Rooney, along with the rest of the England squad, had been given time off by Gareth Southgate following the World Cup qualifying win against Scotland on Friday night and had also been told he would not start the friendly against Spain on Tuesday.
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp on Rooney: ‘All the legends drank like devils and smoked like crazy’

results.firPara: Héctor Bellerín is out of action for an estimated four weeks, leaving Arsenal with a problem at the right-back position the young Spaniard has excelled in.
results.secPara: Arsène Wenger is short of back-up as Mathieu Debuchy has been sidelined with a calf injury, while Carl Jenkinson has only just returned from cruciate ligament damage. Bellerín got injured in the last 10 seconds against Spurs after a very strong tackle by Danny Rose, said Wenger.
results.webTitle: Arsenal suffer blow as Héctor Bellerín is ruled out for four weeks

results.firPara: Marcus Rashfords big audition for José Mourinhos Manchester United will come against Arsenal on Saturday if he is handed the No9 berth. Zlatan Ibrahimovics one-game suspension means a vacancy opens up at centre-forward in a major match for the first time since Mourinho took over and made the Swede his totem signing.
results.secPara: It was against Arsenal that Rashford got his first Premier League goals last February, scoring twice after he had done the same on his debut against Midtjylland three days earlier, and he will hope to lay down another marker against Arsène Wengers side.
results.webTitle: Marcus Rashford can make case for being Manchester United’s ideal No9 | Jamie Jackson

results.firPara: Due to human error, todays tell-all is short and apologetically late ...
results.secPara: Due to human error, todays tell-all is short and apologetically late ...
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Slaven Bilic plans a January clear-out at West Ham?

results.firPara: Gareth Southgate will be confirmed as Englands next permanent manager before the end of the month on a four-year contract, with formal discussions over his appointment expected to start early next week.
results.secPara: The former under-21s coach completed his four-match stint in interim charge with a draw against Spain at Wembley on Tuesday, after victories against Malta and Scotland and a stalemate in Slovenia that secured Englands position at the top of their World Cup qualifying group. The 46-year-old is taking a few days off before a meeting, scheduled for the start of next week, to review his spell in temporary charge but is effectively considered the only candidate to succeed Sam Allardyce.
results.webTitle: Gareth Southgate to land four-year England deal after review
